alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Guernsey; Harrison; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL HARRISON...NORTH CENTRAL GUERNSEY...EAST CENTRAL COSHOCTON AND SOUTHEASTERN TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Newcomerstown, or 14 miles east of Coshocton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Newcomerstown, Gnadenhutten, Tuscarawas, Port Washington, Gilmore, Tippecanoe, Stillwater, and Clendening Lake. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 58 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
